intro: Vernonia lentii, commonly known as the slender ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Vernonia lentii is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
